instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3476: What is 820-3476? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.3V3_S4: What is 3V3_S4? This is an abbreviation of PP3V3_S4, a 3.3v power rail when the machine is in an S4 state. .

threads.title: [SOLVED]3476-A No TrackPad but keyboard and click works
threads.message:
have a wd <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A trackpad not working. connected USB keybpard and mouse and works...just trackpad doesnt work...all keys work and click button on trackpad works.

all voltages seem to be present but i reballed <CHIP>U4801</CHIP> just in case also bought new trackpad/flex but still the same.


here is Diode Mode readings of J4800

1 443
2 695
3 695
4 683
5 01
6 689
7 689
8 689
9 689
10 690
11 690
12 0
13 689
14 689
15 689
16 689
17 689
18 689



any tips would be greatly appreciated 

thanks

threads.title: [SOLVED]3476-A No TrackPad but keyboard and click works
threads.message:
also when i connect flex and measure pin1 = <SIGNAL>PP3V3_TPAD_CONN</SIGNAL>, it fluctuates between 1.3 and 1.8v

edit. nevermind pin1 is solid 1.8v but still nothing :(

threads.title: [SOLVED]3476-A No TrackPad but keyboard and click works
threads.message: ok so when trackpad is not connected i get 3.3v on pin 1 but when connected i get 1.8v. i read somewhere here that it could be bad <RESISTOR>R4808</RESISTOR> so i removed and ran jumper since its 0 ohm, also read another where it could be <CHIP>U8000</CHIP> switch, how can i test if its the switch?

threads.title: [SOLVED]3476-A No TrackPad but keyboard and click works
threads.message: So with <RESISTOR>R4808</RESISTOR> bridged is 3V now present with trackpad connected? You also have to wonder why it failed and it could be a bad trackpad too.

threads.title: [SOLVED]3476-A No TrackPad but keyboard and click works
threads.message:
yeah i thought bad trackpad too but i have two of the same macbooks both waterdamaged and tried with both of those trackpads and thought maybe those were bad so i bought two new ones and still same thing
3.3v is only present on pin 1 if trackpad is disconnected, when trackpad is connected it is 1.8v


what are some possible reasons for voltage dropping on this pin?

threads.title: [SOLVED]3476-A No TrackPad but keyboard and click works
threads.message: A bad <RESISTOR>R4808</RESISTOR> or bad trace/connector. Check on any other component that has <SIGNAL>3V3_S4</SIGNAL> going to it if that also drops to 1.8V, if <SIGNAL>3V3_S4</SIGNAL> drops to 1.8V elsewhere on the board then it points to a dead <CHIP>U8000</CHIP>.

threads.title: [SOLVED]3476-A No TrackPad but keyboard and click works
threads.message:
<RESISTOR>R4808</RESISTOR> was removed.
I checked the her components and 3.3v is present. Only on the pads of <RESISTOR>R4808</RESISTOR> and pin 1 on j4800 is it showing 1.8v while trackpad is connected.
You mentioned bad trace. Does that mean that the circuit leading to the pads on <RESISTOR>R4808</RESISTOR> are bad?
And if that's the case how does one fix this? Am I supposed to run a jumper from closest <SIGNAL>3V3_S4</SIGNAL>?
Thank you for the help

threads.title: [SOLVED]3476-A No TrackPad but keyboard and click works
threads.message: Ok so I ran a jumper from <CAPACITOR>C3510</CAPACITOR> to pin1 and it solved my problem. But do I leave it like this or is there a real fix for this?

threads.title: [SOLVED]3476-A No TrackPad but keyboard and click works
threads.message: As long as 3v3 is getting to the trackpad and the jumper wire is secure it will be fine.

threads.title: [SOLVED]3476-A No TrackPad but keyboard and click works
threads.message: Ok cool, then we can mark this one as solved. I really appreciate your help too. so thank you
